column1: https://www.joebucsfan.com/2025/02/mina-kimes-anything-to-help-the-pass-defense/|Mina Kimes: Anything To Help The Pass Defense|Mina Kimes made it clear on her podcast recently: There’s a lot to like about the Bucs. But the ESPN NFL analyst scrunched up her face like she just opened the door to an uncleaned arena restroom the morning after a Rob Zombie concert when talking about the one thing she doesn’t like about the Bucs. Her facial expression when she mentioned “pass defense” in breaking down the Bucs said it all. Kimes said signing or drafting any playmaker at edge rusher or elsewhere would be a smart move by Bucs AC/DC-loving general manager Jason Licht. “It’s not just one position
column6: you could address any of those. “It’s funny
column7: because I think they’ve really drafted and signed well
column8: this team did. Jason Licht’s a really good GM. But defensively
column9: they haven’t had a ton of success. “I do like Calijah Kancey. And I think YaYa Diaby flashed. But they still really
column10: really have a lot of holes on that defense right now.” Some defensive struggles are bad luck. A chunk of the blame
column12: is because Todd Bowles is still looking to develop his first star edge rusher despite being a coordinator and/or head coach the past 11 seasons (though Joe is far from throwing in the towel on YaYa Diaby and it’s way unfair to judge Chris Braswell after only his rookie season). The Bucs have had bad luck elsewhere on defense. Where would the Bucs’ defense be if Devin White hadn’t fizzled out? Four years ago
column13: White’s three-game stretch in the playoffs — at New Orleans
column14: at Green Bay and in the Super Bowl — was so dominant and maybe only was topped by Lawrence Taylor. (Joe already spelled out that White had a better three-game playoff run than Ray Lewis ever did.) Who knew at the moment White rode his horse around The Licht House hoisting the Vince Lombardi Trophy in the air that he had already peaked and would rapidly circle the drain? He joins the list of defensive guys the Bucs drafted and expected to be game-changing dawgs
column15: but for one reason or another fell on their faces.
